bNSHOx-w6.memHandModelNotes:
Unlike other dabbling ducks this species does not feed out of water (Dubowy 1996) and will actively feed in both deep and shallow water (Bellrose 1980). *****Modeling: Since this species is primarily aquatic during the winter months. So select all vegetative mapping units that fall in the hydro buffer. Amy Silvano 05Sept05

Altered this model to include all map units within the range instead of just water. Changed interior buffer from 0 to 250m to capture shallow water environments. MJR 30 January 2008.

Unlike other dabbling ducks this species does not feed out of water (Dubowy 1996) and will actively feed in both deep and shallow water (Bellrose 1980). *****Modeling: Since this species is primarily aquatic during the winter months. So select all vegetative mapping units that fall in the hydro buffer. Amy Silvano 05Sept05

Altered this model to include all map units within the range instead of just water. Changed interior buffer from 0 to 250m to capture shallow water environments. MJR 30 January 2008.

references.A91LIV01NAUS: Livezey, B. C. 1991. A phylogenetic analysis and classification of recent dabbling ducks (tribe Anatini) based on comparative morphology. Auk 108:471-507.
references.A88ANK01NAUS: Ankney, C. D., and A. D. Afteon. 1988. Bioenergetics of breeding northern shovelers:diet, nutrient reserves, clutch size, and incubation. Condor 90:459-472.
references.B87PRA01NAUS: Pratt, H.D., P.L. Bruner, and D.G. Berrett. 1987. A field guide to the birds of Hawaii and the tropical Pacific. Princeton University Press, Princeton, New Jersey. 409 pp. + 45 plates.
references.B89JOH01NAUS: Johnson, S.R., and D.R. Herter. 1989. The birds of the Beaufort Sea. BP Exploration (Alaska) Inc., Anchorage, Alaska. 372 pp.
references.B88ROO01NAUS: Root, T. 1988. Atlas of wintering North American birds:An analysis of Christmas Bird Count data. University of Chicago Press. 336 pp.
references.B88MAD01NAUS: Madge, S., and H. Burn. 1988. Waterfowl:an identification guide to the ducks, geese and swans of the world. Houghton Mifflin Co., Boston. 298 pp.
references.B83AOU01USGP: American Ornithologists' Union (AOU). 1983. Check-list of North American Birds, 6th edition. Allen Press, Inc., Lawrence, Kansas. 877 pp.
references.A90BAR03NAUS: Barker, W. T., et al. 1990. Effects of specialized grazing systems on waterfowl production in southcentral North Dakota. Trans. 55th North American Wildl. & Nat. Res. Conf., pp. 462-474.
references.B66GOD01NAUS: Godfrey, W.E. 1966. The birds of Canada. National Museums of Canada. Ottawa. 428 pp.
references.B96DUB01SEGP: DuBowy, P.J. 1996. Northern Shoveler (Anas clypeata). In The Birds of North America, No. 215 (A. Poole and F. Gill, eds.). The Academy of Natrual Sciences, Philadelphia, PA, and The American Ornithologists'Union, Washington, D.C.
references.B89STI01NAUS: Stiles, F.G., and A.F. Skutch. 1989. A guide to the birds of Costa Rica. Comstock Publ. Associates, Cornell University Press, Ithaca, New York. 511 pp.
references.B76BEL01NAUS: Bellrose, F.C. 1976. Ducks, geese and swans of North America. Stackpole Books, Harrisburg, Pa.
references.B80TER01NAUS: Terres, J.K. 1980. The Audubon Society encyclopedia of North American birds. Alfred A. Knopf, New York.
references.B78HAR01NAUS: Harrison, C. 1978. A field guide to the nests, eggs and nestlings of North American birds. Collins, Cleveland, Ohio.
references.B86HIL01NAUS: Hilty, S.L., and W.L. Brown. 1986. A guide to the birds of Colombia. Princeton University Press, Princeton, New Jersey. 836 pp.
